intro: Mariscus cundudoensis, commonly known as the Cunduvense mariscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
